findings.title: PVC - Price Volatility Concern
findings.description: The contract accumulates tokens from taxes to swap them for ETH, but the variable `swapAmount` can be set to a big number, triggering a huge amount of token swaps, which can lead to significant price volatility due to the token's highly volatile price.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The Solidity style guide is a set of guidelines for writing clean and consistent Solidity code. Adhering to a style guide can help improve the readability and maintainability of the Solidity code, making it easier for others to understand and work with.

findings.title: L05 - Unused State Variable
findings.description: An unused state variable is a state variable that is declared in the contract, but is never used in any of the contract's functions.

findings.title: L07 - Missing Events Arithmetic
findings.description: Events are a way to record and log information about changes or actions that occur within a contract. They are often used to notify external parties or clients about events that have occurred within the contract, such as the transfer of tokens or the completion of a task.

findings.title: L12 - Using Variables before Declaration
findings.description: The contract is using a variable before the declaration. This is usually happening either if it has not been declared yet or if the variable has been declared in a different scope.

findings.title: L14 - Uninitialized Variables in Local Scope
findings.description: Using an uninitialized local variable can lead to unpredictable behavior and potentially cause errors in the contract.
